database
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  database.Connection

public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

This connection class houses the Cache database connection and other capabilities that correspond directly to this connection. It also houses the logger as it logs all connection related errors to disk. On the J2ee server the logs are held by the server. This class also closes and cleans up the connection when the function closeResultset is called. Other capabilities of this class are generating resultsets and showing data from this set. Returning a working Database object. Opening the Connection to the database. And executing Sql code.

Author:
ICT09

Constructor Detail

Connection

public Connection()
The constructor opens the loger and instantiates the connection object It also opens the file handler for the logger. Please note that on the J2EE server logging is handled by the server, an attempt to open a new log file wil result in a security exception.

Method Detail

closeResultset

public boolean closeResultset()
Closes the connection and cleans up. It closes the logger that was opened in the constructor. It tries to close a resultset, if there was any opened, this is not always so. It closes the connection.

Returns:
If this fails for some reason, the function returns false.

createConnection

public boolean createConnection()
Creates a connection, You can get a reference to this connection trough the getConnection function.

Returns:
If the connection failed this returns false

nextResult

public boolean nextResult()
If a resultset was created this navigates the resultset to the next result It also logs any possible errors.

Returns:
returns true as long as there are no errors and the cursor moved to the next result

generateResultSet

public boolean generateResultSet(java.lang.String sqlQuery)
Generates and returns a resultset based on sql query You can later on use the function nextResult and getResultString and others to use this resultset You can also exctract the full resultset, should you have more advanced needs.

Parameters:
sqlQuery - The query this function will base its resultset on
Returns:
True if there was a resultset

executeQuery

Executes a sql query, useful for complex updates or deletes.

Parameters:
sqlQuery - The query to execute
Returns:
true if succes, false if it fails
